sourcesContent:
Counter

This is a simple example of an Angular component.

Current count: {{ playerData.level }}

Id Name Desc
{{ item.id }} {{ item.name }} {{ item.description }}
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-counter-component', templateUrl: './counter.component.html' }) export class CounterComponent { public playerData = new PlayerData(10, 100, 5); public addRandomItem() { this.playerData.inventory.items.push(new Item(`Item_${Math.random()}`, `Description_${Math.random()}`)); } public addLevel() { this.playerData.level++; } } class Inventory { public readonly items: Item[] = []; public get empty(): boolean { return this.items.length == 0; } public get itemsCount(): number { return this.items.length; } public get lastItem(): Item { return this.items[this.items.length - 1]; } } class Item { private static lastId = 0; public static readonly NONE_ITEM = "[none_item]"; public static readonly NONE_ITEM_DESCRIPTION = "[none_item_description]"; public id = -1; public name = Item.NONE_ITEM; public description = Item.NONE_ITEM_DESCRIPTION; constructor(name: string, description: string) { this.name = name; this.description = description; this.id = Item.lastId++; } } export class PlayerData { public level = 0; public hp = 0; public speed = 0; public inventory = new Inventory(); constructor(level: number, hp: number, speed: number) { this.level = level; this.hp = hp; this.speed = speed; this.inventory = new Inventory(); } }
